race.name: Veneto Gravel
race.tagline: Italian Veneto hilly gravel in Asolo.

terrain.surface: Gravel roads through Veneto hills. Significant elevation with Italian countryside scenery.

gravel_god_rating.score_note: Regional Italian event. Hilly Veneto terrain with moderate organization and regional field.

biased_opinion.summary: Veneto Gravel is a regional event in Asolo, Italyâ€”hilly terrain with significant elevation. The Italian countryside is scenic, but the moderate organization and regional field keep it firmly in Tier 3.
biased_opinion.bottom_line: A scenic Italian gravel race with Veneto hills. Worth it for European cyclists. Not a destination race for international travelers.

final_verdict.one_liner: Italian Veneto hilly gravel in Asolo.
final_verdict.should_you_race: If you're in Italy/Europeâ€”yes, it's solid. If you're internationalâ€”there are better options.
final_verdict.alternatives: For similar Italian events: other Italian gravel races. For better organization: Grinduro Italy.

logistics.food: Asolo has full dining options. Stock nutrition.

marketplace_variables.race_hook: Italian Veneto hilly gravel in Asolo.

logistics.explanation: Multiple conflicting start dates (April 17, 18, 23-24, or 25) and locations remain unresolved across sources. Claudia Gerosa successfully pre-booked hotels for her 2.5-day approach, splitting the Short Beach into Bassano-Quarto d'Altino-Vittorio Veneto stages. The event provides a start village with staff welcome, event packs, and finisher facilities including showers and meals, but basic logistical details stay frustratingly inconsistent.

length.explanation: Multiple distance options accommodate different ambitions: 200km Newbie, 400km Short Beach/Short Lake, and 700km Classic. Stefano Rodighiero completed the Short Beach 400km over four days with daily stages of 132km, 111km, 101km, and 53km. The multi-day format allows riders to "split your route into four days and take up the entire allocated time" with Friday-to-Tuesday flexibility. Similar distance to Crusher in the Tushar.

technicality.explanation: Riders report "a bit of fun technical riding on easy singletrack" through the Valpolicella Hills between Verona and Lake Garda. The route includes intentional walking sections where "there even are some sections that are meant to be walked, pushing the bike" for phenomenal sightseeing. Surface conditions center on "mostly unpaved" canal roads alongside rivers and waterways throughout the Veneto plain. Less technical than The Mid South.

elevation.explanation: The Short Beach packs 2,800m elevation into 400km while the Short Lake reduces climbing to 1,800m over the same distance. Notable climbs include Passo San Boldo and routes "up to the foot of the Dolomites." The Newbie route delivers the steepest profile at 2,800m elevation over just 200km, making for significantly more vertical per kilometer than the longer options. Similar elevation profile to Gravel Worlds.

climate.explanation: Historical weather data shows average highs of 54Â°F and lows of 40Â°F, with a 32% chance of rain on any given day. Recent editions show variable April conditions. One 2024 rider experienced "sun, rain, wind, more wind, thunderstorms but also a lot of laughter." Stefano Rodighiero noted in 2025 that "the weather in the first two day was not the best" with his pace dropping notably on day three, likely weather-related. Another 2025 participant saw "thick, dark clouds looming over the mountains" but "almost no rain." Similar climate challenges to SBT GRVL.

altitude.explanation: Routes stay in the Veneto lowlands and foothills with no significant altitude challenges. The terrain spans "rivers, countryside, rural landscapes, natural and coastal environments, up to the foot of the Dolomites" but doesn't climb into alpine elevations. Starting near sea level around the Venetian plain, the event requires zero altitude acclimatization. Lower altitude than Gravel Worlds â€” no thin-air concerns.

adventure.explanation: The route "opens up a hidden side of Italy, full of little-known tracks and long-forgotten corners" through diverse terrain that "changes face with every kilometer." Riders navigate the Lapisina Valley on paths different from obvious routes, plus the distinctive "Cento giorni" Piave section. The flexible format means "some sleep under the stars in a sleeping bag, some stop for a hot meal in a Venetian tavern."

prestige.explanation: Growth from 328 cyclists in 2023 to over 1,300 in 2025 makes it "the biggest gravel bikepacking event in Europe" drawing "participants from over 20 countries." However, the event explicitly states "Veneto Gravel non Ã¨ una gara!" [Veneto Gravel is not a race!] with no results list or timing â€” "you'll sign your name on the finisher's board" instead.

race_quality.explanation: The non-competitive format eliminates traditional race infrastructure like timing chips or results. Riders collect stamps at checkpoints for brevet completion rather than racing against the clock. As one participant noted, "there's not even a result's list" and "no big clock timing you as you cross the finish line." The focus stays purely on completing the adventure rather than performance metrics.

experience.explanation: Riders consistently praise the diverse landscapes. One described routes through "rivers, countryside, rural landscapes, natural and coastal environments, up to the foot of the Dolomites." Claudia Gerosa emphasized riding "in nature with a hand always ready to take a photo" through "incredible nature, new sights, rural Northern Italy, rolling hills, and the postcard-perfect cities and towns of Veneto."

community.explanation: The event drew over 1,300 participants in 2025, making it "the biggest gravel bikepacking event in Europe" with riders from over 20 countries. The atmosphere emphasizes "no pressure or competition" with organizers Roberto Polato and Velia Agostini who "travel the tracks kilometer by kilometer." Video reports capture "a lot of laughter" even during challenging weather, reflecting the supportive non-competitive culture.

field_depth.explanation: The explicitly non-competitive format attracts adventure-seekers rather than racers. Participants range from first-time bikepackers ("my first time riding a loaded bike by night") to experienced riders completing 700km classics in 54 hours. Without timing or results, there's no way to measure competitive depth â€” everyone's just "completing the route" at their chosen pace and style. Less competitive depth than Almanzo 100.

value.explanation: Registration includes welcome village facilities, event pack, checkpoints with stamps, finisher celebration with showers and meals. The multi-route format (200-700km options) provides flexibility for different budgets and time commitments. With 1,300+ participants creating economies of scale for what's become "the biggest gravel bikepacking event in Europe," the infrastructure appears well-developed for the participation fee.

expenses.explanation: Registration runs â‚¬60-100. Northern Italy near Venice and Lake Garda carries tourist-level pricing for accommodation. Claudia Gerosa managed costs by pre-booking hotels for her 2.5-day approach, while others "sleep under the stars" or find "somewhere comfy to sleep" in historic villages. The event allows "any bike: MTB, road bike, fat bike, plus, e-bike" reducing equipment requirements, though organizers recommend gravel bikes as ideal. Higher total cost than Badlands.

2024.conditions: No 2025 dates confirmed in results; past event was April 22, 2024 in Piazzola sul Brenta per ahotu
key_takeaways: Distance options include: Veneto Gravel Short Beach (400km, +2800m elevation), Veneto Gravel Short Lake (400km, +1800m, introduced 2023), Veneto Grave

primary.name: Specialized Pathfinder Pro
primary.why: Fast center, grippy edges. The modern all-rounder benchmark.

primary.name: Panaracer GravelKing SK
primary.why: Affordable all-rounder. Light knobs add grip without killing speed.

primary.name: Vittoria Terreno Mix
primary.why: Graphene versatility. Mixed-terrain grip with reasonable rolling speed.

front_rear_split.rationale: Faster front for reduced rolling resistance on straights, grippier rear for traction on loose climbs and corners

videos.title: ASOLO GRAVEL TOUR
videos.description:
Asolo Gravel Tour

Giro in bici gravel fino nel centro storico di Asolo. Partenza da Montecchio Maggiore. Il percorso passa per Quinto Vicentino, LanzÃ¨, sullâ€™Itinerario Ciclopedonale del Brenta e sul Sentiero degli Ezzelini. Questa gravellata Ã¨ quasi tutta pianeggiante (salvo la salita ad Asolo) e si pedala tra le provincie di Vicenza e Treviso, in Veneto. Si pedala su parte della Ciclovia Fiume Brenta e su parte del Sentiero degli Ezzelini. Da Asolo si raggiunge Bassano del Grappa passando sul Ponte degli Alpini. Si percorrono poi tanti argini e strade sterrate alternati a strade asfaltate transitando per Marostica e Breganze. Infine Itinerario delle Risorgive del Bacchiglione e ritorno a Montecchio Maggiore su strade secondarie. PiÃ¹ del 50% del giro Ã¨ su piste ciclabili/percorsi gravel, in parte asfaltati e in parte sterrati. Percorso ideale per chi vuole fare cicloturismo in Veneto.

Asolo Gravel Tour Ã¨ la quarta di una serie di gravellate che abbiamo tracciato e che vi raccontiamo qui su YouTube. Qui sul nostro canale trovate una playlist che chiamiamo Winter Gravel Tours dove raggruppiamo tutti questi itinerari adatti ad essere percorsi in gravel bike in inverno. Gli ingredienti per considerarsi Winter Gravel Tour sono: 100km circa belli scorrevoli, salite brevi, piÃ¹ ghiaia e sole possibile. La partenza sarÃ  sempre da Vicenza e ci si dirigerÃ  un pÃ² verso tutti i punti cardinali.

Questo percorso cicloturistico di 145km e 600 metri di dislivello Ã¨ indicato a tutti. Ideale da percorrere nella stagione invernale. La bicicletta adatta Ã¨ una gravel bike in quanto sono presenti dei percorsi ciclabili sterrati. Ecco la traccia: https://www.komoot.it/tour/666635502 

Abbiamo percorso questa gravellata con le nostre bici gravel 3T Exploro Race con single speed Shimano GRX 40T e 11-42, pneumatici Specialized Pathfinder tubeless da 38mm, borraccia Jet Elite Cycling da 550ml, portaoggetti Takuin Elite Cycling e borse da bikepacking di Miss Grape.

0:00 Vicenza
1:26 Itinerario del Brenta
4:43 Sentiero degli Ezzelini
6:39 Asolo
8:41 Bassano del Grappa
11:14 Risorgive del Bacchiglione

Puoi acquistare il nostro Kit Gravellata by Miss Grape qui: https://missgrape.net/limited-edition/kit-gravellata-by-miss-grape/

ATTREZZATURA: 
- 3T Bike Exploro Race GRX 1X
- Kit Gravellata by Miss Grape
- maglia Supergiara Gravellata by Sportful
- bib Sportful Supergiara Bibshort
- calzini Sportful Matchy Socks
- completo invernale Castelli Cycling
- scarpe Fizik Terra Powerstrap X4
- casco Met Helmets Allroad
- sella Fizik Terra Argo X3
- nastro manubrio Fizik Terra Bondcush 3mm tacky
- borraccia Elite Cycling Jet 550ml
- portaborraccia Elite Cycling Prism
- porta oggetti Elite Cycling Takuin 550
- tenda Ferrino Tent Set
- saccoletto Ferrino Lightec SM 850
- materassino Ferrino Air-Lite
- luce anteriore Ravemen PR 1600 
- luce anteriore Ravemen LR 500 S
- luce posteriore Ravemen TR 50
- cover smartphone e bag Eevye
- fornello Jetboil Zip
- cartuccia gas Decathlon
- piumino comprimibile Forclaz Decathlon 

ATTREZZATURA FOTO E VIDEO
- iPhone 13 PRO
- GoPro Hero 9 Black
- Drone DJI Mini 2
- Sony RX 100 Mark III

Segui le nostre gravellate su: 
- INSTAGRAM: https://www.instagram.com/gravellata.cc/
- SITO WEB: https://gravellata.cc/
- FACEBOOK: https://www.facebook.com/gravellata.cc
- KOMOOT: https://www.komoot.it/user/1542604803444
- YOUTUBE @3tcycling: https://bit.ly/3xWf6uE

Registriamo le gravellate con Garmin Edge 830.

Montiamo i video con Adobe Premiere Pro.

Musica: Epidemic Sound 

Scrivici a: gravellata@gmail.com

videos.title: Gravel Adventure sul Sentiero degli Ezzelini: da Asolo a Castelfranco Veneto
videos.description:
In questo video ti porto con me in un giro gravel sul suggestivo Sentiero degli Ezzelini, percorrendo il tratto da Pagnano fino a Castelfranco Veneto. Un itinerario ricco di natura, sterrati scorrevoli e scorci perfetti per chi ama pedalare immerso nel verde del Veneto.
Il percorso alterna tratti veloci a sezioni piÃ¹ tecniche, ideali per godersi appieno la bici gravel. Se stai cercando idee per le tue prossime uscite o vuoi scoprire uno dei percorsi piÃ¹ affascinanti della zona, questo video fa per te!

ðŸ‘‰ Iscriviti al canale per altri percorsi gravel e bike adventure
ðŸ‘‰ Scrivi nei commenti se hai giÃ  fatto questo sentiero o se hai percorsi da consigliarmi!
